content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format.(For each problem, you need to provide your thought process and ultimately present the conclusion in the form of "Therefore, the final answer is: ")

To find the shortest path from node 8 to node 12, I will perform a breadth-first search (BFS) starting from node 8 and explore all possible paths until I reach node 12.

1. Start at node 8.
2. From node 8, I can go to node 21 (8->21).
3. From node 21, I can go to node 5 (21->5) or node 14 (21->14).
4. From node 5, I can go to node 6 (5->6) or node 13 (5->13) or node 21 (5->21).
5. From node 14, I can go to node 11 (14->11) or node 21 (14->21).
6. From node 11, I can go to node 17 (11->17) or node 14 (11->14).
7. From node 17, I can go to node 11 (17->11).
8. From node 6, I can go to node 5 (6->5).
9. From node 13, I can go to node 5 (13->5) or node 22 (13->22).
10. From node 22, I can go to node 13 (22->13).
11. From node 12, I can go to node 3 (12->3) or node 15 (12->15).

Now, I have reached node 12, which is the destination. The shortest path is 8->21->14->11->12.

Therefore, the final answer is: 8->21->14->11->12

To find the shortest path from node 12 to node 8, I will perform a breadth-first search (BFS) starting from node 12 and explore all possible paths until I reach node 8.

1. Start at node 12.
2. From node 12, I can go to node 3 (12->3) or node 15 (12->15).
3. From node 3, I can go to node 1 (3->1) or node 19 (3->19) or node 12 (3->12).
4. From node 15, I can go to node 9 (15->9) or node 12 (15->12) or node 16 (15->16).
5. From node 16, I can go to node 0 (16->0) or node 10 (16->10) or node 15 (16->15).
6. From node 10, I can go to node 2 (10->2) or node 20 (10->20) or node 16 (10->16).
7. From node 20, I can go to node 4 (20->4) or node 10 (20->10) or node 18 (20->18) or node 23 (20->23).
8. From node 18, I can go to node 20 (18->20) or node 21 (18->21).
9. From node 21, I can go to node 5 (21->5) or node 8 (21->8) or node 14 (21->14) or node 18 (21->18).

Now, I have reached node 8, which is the destination. The shortest path is 12->15->16->10->20->18->21->8.

Therefore, the final answer is: 12->15->16->10->20->18->21->8
